sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The 27-nation bloc has so far trained 34,000 Ukrainian personnel for the front line, making the EU the biggest provider of training for Ukraine's military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Despite the war still raging on, the E.U. and Ukrainian government are starting preparations for the post-war reconstruction of the embattled country, with the aim of rebuilding it better and greener once the fighting is over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: European Commission, Ukrainian government and businesses all gathered in Vilnius on Tuesday to discuss the necessary preparations, saying that once the war ends, reconstruction plans must already be in place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The war started by Russia has had devastating effects on nature in the country, for example, the destruction of the Kharkov water dam, which resulted in the worst human-made ecocide since the Chernobyl nuclear plant incident in 1987.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We have a unique opportunity to build back better and greener.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So when we talk about cities that were destroyed, we talk about the sustainable planning of those cities, integrating the most recent knowledge. I'm very pleased to see so many architects across Europe who are actually devoting their time. When we talk about public buildings which massively were destroyed, hospitals, schools, kindergartens, they all will have to be energy efficient. They all will have to be powered with the renewable energy. Ukraine currently has the most landmines in any European country and around 34 animal species have disappeared due to the fighting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The country's forests have also suffered serious losses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But the biggest challenge is not only restoring nature, but also to have a climate-neutral economy after the war finishes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For this, Ukraine needs to transform its energy network and rebuild public and residential buildings in an energy-efficient way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The reconstruction of the country is a tempting opportunity for many European countries who have already signalled their interest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Representatives of the building industry as well as water and waste management companies also took part in the discussions in Vilnius.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We are not talking about just international support, like direct support to restore something.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: No, we are talking about some investments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And first of all, we need cooperation with investors to build new facilities, to build new technologies, to build new maybe industries, but using best available technologies in a European way, like in European legislation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: According to the European Commission, the reconstruction of Ukraine will have a massive cost, and Russia must pay for it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Another challenge will be to convince the 6 million Ukrainians currently living in Europe to move home and contribute to the rebuilding efforts.
